Reviews.Title: “Simple and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sabi04uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend, its the biggest Hotel Room i have ever stayed in. Absolutely no complaints, although if you expect breakfast. Its coffee and croissants. The Staff very friendly and are so helpful. I would say its a budget Hotel but the way i see it is that Rome is Amazing and you will only be in your room to sleep and shower. So perfect if you only going to sleep there

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly italian Hotel)”
Reviews.Author: ShuriKJerusalem
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel in September with my friends.We went to Roma for vacations. Frankly speaking, we really enjoyed our stay there. Yes, the rooms are not very big, but they are enough comfortable for 3 persons, and the staff in hotel was really very friendly! We also liked the location of the hotel, it is not far from the center of the city and there are a lot of places to eat near by. If you came to Rome to see the city and not to stay in the hotel all day long, you will enjoy this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quad room was spacious, comfortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: CdnGurl34
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a cost effective solution to being in Italy with our family of 4- we stayed at the hotel monaco in rome for 5 nights and it was comfortable, clean and spacious ( for Europe). The staff was friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels we have ever met in Europe”
Reviews.Author: tatyana67
Reviews.Content: The room and bathroom were extremely small and uncomfortable. Out of our small frosted window we had a view to a tiny dark inner yard. Breakfast was terribly poor. Additionally, we met insects (cockroachs) in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: tlcorda
Reviews.Content: Of the 5 hotels we stayed at on our Europe trip this one was by far the worst. The room was quite small, especially for 4 people (two adults and 2 teenagers). The room had a musty smell that was quite disturbing. The bathroom was very small with an accordian style 'door'. They claim to have air-conditioning, and they did have a unit over the door but it did not work. They also claim to have Wi-fi in the room, well the only way we could access it was by opening the door to the room and puting the table halfway out into the hallway. I would advise anyone to stay away from this hotel and any of it's partners.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: princess_twenty
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel in all my travels. Made the mistake of booking Rome last minute. Always book Rome hotels before you start your vacation, or else you'll have difficulty finding room, and you will pay through the nose. I am not a picky traveler, but this hotel was awful. They showed me a room with the toilet in the shower, and I asked to upgrade to a better room. The room I ended up with had the shower separated from the toilet, thank goodness. But the water took 5 - 10 min. to warm up. The window leading to the courtyard did not lock properly (Room30) so I worried about someone breaking in. The room door had a HUGE keyhole, so anyone from the hallway could scoot up to the door and peek in. I had to hang a piece of paper over the hole.(!) The topsheet of the bed felt dirty when I touched it. The room was so small, I could barely put my small suitcase in their so-called "closet". When we walked around the community, we felt very unsafe and nothing was open at night. The maid left my backpack right by the door, with the door wide open! I could only stand to stay for 2 nights before getting a really expensive room at Best Western (it was so worth it). It would have only been 1 night, but we had trouble finding accomodation. Only stay at Hotel Monaco if you normally stay in dirty huts.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Djjhill
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with most of the reviews on this hotel because they are all correct. First of all i must say i didn't see the room so i wil not comment on the standard of the actual room. What i will say is that after travelling half way around the world with my wife and 2 small children, arriving at this hotel was the biggest mistake we made when we travelled to Italy. Since we had booked and paid 3 months earlier we were confident we would get a room at the hotel even though after reading the reviews we were concerened about the standard of the hotel. We walked into it with reservations but a very open mind considering that it was only a 2 star but was shocked when we arrived and got told there was no room for us. We were asked if we could go on the other side of the city to a sister hotel for the night and then return for the following 4 nights to finish our stay in the city. After a very heated argument with the "manager/operator" we told him that we would change hotels only if we stayed there for our whole stay (the hotel was a 3 star hotel) and that they would pay for the taxi ride. He wasn't happy with this but we gave him no choice and told him that this was not good enough and we were not going to travel back and forth. He agreed with all our requests and the other hotel was FANTASITIC. so the one thing i would say is DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!! instead spend the extra $20 euros or so a night and stay at the Santa Prassede (see our review on this hotel).

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS THE PITS”
Reviews.Author: sharmac
Reviews.Content: DONT EVEN THINK ABOUT THIS PLACE. We didnt want luxury at all from our accomodation but we we got here was nothing short of a disaster. Yes, the rooms are small. The shower is over the toilet, thats how cramped our bathroom was. Our room backed onto the rear of the reception and so the vending machine kept going off all night and the noise from the kitchen on the morning was argghhhhh disturbing. The stupid cleaners through out my partners contact lenses and all we were told was "tough" they shouldnt have been in the bathroom and to call our travel agent....after trying to sort this out with them directly they switched off our hot water, NOT that there was much hot water to start with. OH and our "continental" breakfast was a basket full of croissants and a juice machine which didnt work. do not stay here, keep looking, im sure theres better basic hotels than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome and stayed at this hotel for one night. The staff was friendly and spoke english and spanish (italian of course). The room is very basic with a TV and bed and bathroom (Didn't even use the TV). Great place to rest for the night, but not anything extravagant. I wanted to stay in town, near the trains, cabs, etc with no real regard to luxury acommodations. Monaco gave me that. The breakfast was great with several different types of fruitfilled rolls, coffee, and juices (no charge). After that, I was on my way. Do you want luxury Hotel? Don't Stay here. Do you want a basic clean place to lay your head and freshen up close to trains (3 blocks)? Try this place.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend with my (adult) kids in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My kids (24 and 26 jr) offered me (63) a trip to Rome; We got (by internet) a room for three persons three nights and breakfast. We could walk from termini station to the hotel (less than half an hour). The elevator was out of order, but the stairs took only one turn. The room was fine, a single bed for my daughter and 170 cm/180 bed for my son and me with two matrasses. The lightbulb in the bathroom was ok at that moment, later not, and the promise to repair it was not fullfilled when we left on monday (ok where do you find your handyman in the weekend). Room, towels and sheets, soap, toilet, douche,spic and span clean Breakfast was simple, but we could take what we wanted (marmelade and bread) Drinks available hot milk, coffee, thee, chocolate from an apparate. The man at the entrace was kind, there was a map from Rome to take with you on your tour. On saturday we could go for a walk because the hotel is near all great sites. On sunday to Vatican-city we used the subway, and walked back. We really do recommend this place. Simple and usefull.

Reviews.Title: “It is quite good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, it was a good place to rest. It is not a place for a Honey moon coz it is not luxurious the price indicated that, but It was a nice and tidy room and cosy with clean sheets. I liked it... I recommend it for an economic trip.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Monaco
HotelInfo.Address: Via Flavia 84, 00100 Rome, Italy
